name: UGameplayAbility
doc: Abilities define custom gameplay logic that can be activated by players or external game logic

bReplicateInputDirectly: If true, this ability will always replicate input press/release events to the server.
ReplicationPolicy: How an ability replicates state/events to everyone on the network. Replication is not required for NetExecutionPolicy.
InstancingPolicy: How the ability is instanced when executed. This limits what an ability can do in its implementation.
bServerRespectsRemoteAbilityCancellation: If this is set, the server-side version of the ability can be canceled by the client-side version. The client-side version can always be canceled by the server.
bRetriggerInstancedAbility: if true, and trying to activate an already active instanced ability, end it and re-trigger it.
CurrentActivationInfo: This is information specific to this instance of the ability. E.g, whether it is predicting, authoring, confirmed, etc.
CurrentEventData: Information specific to this instance of the ability, if it was activated by an event
NetExecutionPolicy: How does an ability execute on the network. Does a client "ask and predict", "ask and wait", "don't ask (just do it)".
NetSecurityPolicy: What protections does this ability have? Should the client be allowed to request changes to the execution of the ability?
CostGameplayEffectClass: This GameplayEffect represents the cost (mana, stamina, etc) of the ability. It will be applied when the ability is committed.
AbilityTriggers: Triggers to determine if this ability should execute in response to an event
CooldownGameplayEffectClass: This GameplayEffect represents the cooldown. It will be applied when the ability is committed and the ability cannot be used again until it is expired.
CancelAbilitiesWithTag: Abilities with these tags are cancelled when this ability is executed
BlockAbilitiesWithTag: Abilities with these tags are blocked while this ability is active
ActivationOwnedTags: Tags to apply to activating owner while this ability is active. These are replicated if ReplicateActivationOwnedTags is enabled in AbilitySystemGlobals.
ActivationRequiredTags: This ability can only be activated if the activating actor/component has all of these tags
ActivationBlockedTags: This ability is blocked if the activating actor/component has any of these tags
SourceRequiredTags: This ability can only be activated if the source actor/component has all of these tags
SourceBlockedTags: This ability is blocked if the source actor/component has any of these tags
TargetRequiredTags: This ability can only be activated if the target actor/component has all of these tags
TargetBlockedTags: This ability is blocked if the target actor/component has any of these tags

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectToOwner
methods.doc: Apply a gameplay effect to the owner of this ability

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectToTarget
methods.doc: Apply a gameplay effect to a Target

methods.name: RemoveGameplayEffectFromOwnerWithAssetTags
methods.doc: Removes GameplayEffects from owner which match the given asset level tags

methods.name: RemoveGameplayEffectFromOwnerWithGrantedTags
methods.doc: Removes GameplayEffects from owner which grant the given tags

methods.name: RemoveGameplayEffectFromOwnerWithHandle
methods.doc: Removes GameplayEffect from owner that match the given handle

methods.name: CancelTaskByInstanceName
methods.doc: Add any task with this instance name to a list to be canceled (not ended) next frame.  See also EndTaskByInstanceName.

methods.name: ConfirmTaskByInstanceName
methods.doc: Finds all currently active tasks named InstanceName and confirms them. What this means depends on the individual task. By default, this does nothing other than ending if bEndTask is true.

methods.name: EndAbilityState
methods.doc: Ends any active ability state task with the given name. If name is 'None' all active states will be ended (in an arbitrary order).

methods.name: EndTaskByInstanceName
methods.doc: Add any task with this instance name to a list to be ended (not canceled) next frame.  See also CancelTaskByInstanceName.

methods.name: GetAbilityLevel
methods.doc: Returns current level of the Ability

methods.name: GetAbilityLevel_BP
methods.doc: Returns current ability level for non instanced abilities. You must call this version in these contexts!

methods.name: GetAbilitySystemComponentFromActorInfo
methods.doc: Returns the AbilitySystemComponent that is activating this ability

methods.name: GetActorInfo
methods.doc: Returns the actor info associated with this ability, has cached pointers to useful objects

methods.name: GetAvatarActorFromActorInfo
methods.doc: Returns the physical actor that is executing this ability. May be null

methods.name: GetContextFromOwner
methods.doc: Generates a GameplayEffectContextHandle from our owner and an optional TargetData.

methods.name: GetCooldownTimeRemaining
methods.doc: Returns the time in seconds remaining on the currently active cooldown.

methods.name: GetCurrentMontage
methods.doc: Returns the currently playing montage for this ability, if any

methods.name: GetCurrentSourceObject
methods.doc: Retrieves the SourceObject associated with this ability. Can only be called on instanced abilities.

methods.name: GetGrantedByEffectContext
methods.doc: Retrieves the EffectContext of the GameplayEffect that granted this ability. Can only be called on instanced abilities.

methods.name: GetOwningActorFromActorInfo
methods.doc: Returns the actor that owns this ability, which may not have a physical location

methods.name: GetOwningComponentFromActorInfo
methods.doc: Convenience method for abilities to get skeletal mesh component - useful for aiming abilities

methods.name: GetSourceObject_BP
methods.doc: Retrieves the SourceObject associated with this ability. Callable on non instanced

methods.name: InvalidateClientPredictionKey
methods.doc:
Invalidates the current prediction key. This should be used in cases where there is a valid prediction window, but the server is doing logic that only it can do, and afterwards performs an action that the client could predict (had the client been able to run the server-only code prior).
This returns instantly and has no other side effects other than clearing the current prediction key.

methods.name: IsLocallyControlled
methods.doc: True if the owning actor is locally controlled, true in single player

methods.name: ActivateAbility
methods.doc:
The main function that defines what an ability does.
 -Child classes will want to override this
 -This function graph should call CommitAbility
 -This function graph should call EndAbility

 Latent/async actions are ok in this graph. Note that Commit and EndAbility calling requirements speak to the K2_ActivateAbility graph.
 In C++, the call to K2_ActivateAbility() may return without CommitAbility or EndAbility having been called. But it is expected that this
 will only occur when latent/async actions are pending. When K2_ActivateAbility logically finishes, then we will expect Commit/End to have been called.

methods.name: AddGameplayCue
methods.doc: Adds a persistent gameplay cue to the ability owner. Optionally will remove if ability ends

methods.name: AddGameplayCueWithParams
methods.doc: Adds a persistent gameplay cue to the ability owner. Optionally will remove if ability ends

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectSpecToOwner
methods.doc: Apply a previously created gameplay effect spec to the owner of this ability

methods.name: ApplyGameplayEffectSpecToTarget
methods.doc: Apply a previously created gameplay effect spec to a target

methods.name: CanActivateAbility
methods.doc: Returns true if this ability can be activated right now. Has no side effects

methods.name: CancelAbility
methods.doc: Call from Blueprint to cancel the ability naturally

methods.name: CheckAbilityCooldown
methods.doc: Checks the ability's cooldown, but does not apply it.

methods.name: CheckAbilityCost
methods.doc: Checks the ability's cost, but does not apply it.

methods.name: CommitAbility
methods.doc: Attempts to commit the ability (spend resources, etc). This our last chance to fail. Child classes that override ActivateAbility must call this themselves!

methods.name: CommitAbilityCooldown
methods.doc: Attempts to commit the ability's cooldown only. If BroadcastCommitEvent is true, it will broadcast the commit event that tasks like WaitAbilityCommit are listening for.

methods.name: CommitAbilityCost
methods.doc: Attempts to commit the ability's cost only. If BroadcastCommitEvent is true, it will broadcast the commit event that tasks like WaitAbilityCommit are listening for.

methods.name: CommitExecute
methods.doc: BP event called from CommitAbility

methods.name: EndAbility
methods.doc: Call from blueprints to forcibly end the ability without canceling it. This will replicate the end ability to the client or server which can interrupt tasks

methods.name: EndAbilityLocally
methods.doc: Call from blueprints to end the ability naturally. This will only end predicted abilities locally, allowing it end naturally on the client or server

methods.name: ExecuteGameplayCue
methods.doc: Invoke a gameplay cue on the ability owner

methods.name: ExecuteGameplayCueWithParams
methods.doc: Invoke a gameplay cue on the ability owner, with extra parameters

methods.name: OnEndAbility
methods.doc: Blueprint event, will be called if an ability ends normally or abnormally

methods.name: RemoveGameplayCue
methods.doc: Removes a persistent gameplay cue from the ability owner

methods.name: ShouldAbilityRespondToEvent
methods.doc: Returns true if this ability can be activated right now. Has no side effects

methods.name: MakeOutgoingGameplayEffectSpec
methods.doc: Convenience method for abilities to get outgoing gameplay effect specs (for example, to pass on to projectiles to apply to whoever they hit)

methods.name: MakeTargetLocationInfoFromOwnerActor
methods.doc: Creates a target location from where the owner avatar is

methods.name: MakeTargetLocationInfoFromOwnerSkeletalMeshComponent
methods.doc: Creates a target location from a socket on the owner avatar's skeletal mesh

methods.name: MontageJumpToSection
methods.doc: Immediately jumps the active montage to a section

methods.name: MontageSetNextSectionName
methods.doc: Sets pending section on active montage

methods.name: MontageStop
methods.doc:
Stops the current animation montage.

@param OverrideBlendTime If >= 0, will override the BlendOutTime parameter on the AnimMontage instance

methods.name: RemoveGrantedByEffect
methods.doc: Removes the GameplayEffect that granted this ability. Can only be called on instanced abilities.

methods.name: SendGameplayEvent
methods.doc: Sends a gameplay event, also creates a prediction window

methods.name: SetCanBeCanceled
methods.doc: Sets whether the ability should ignore cancel requests. Only valid on instanced abilities

methods.name: SetShouldBlockOtherAbilities
methods.doc: Sets rather ability block flags are enabled or disabled. Only valid on instanced abilities
